meanings.sent1: The cozy cabin had a shingled roof to keep the rain out.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a shingled exterior that needed repair.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a shingled spot to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her shingled hair glistened in the sunlight like a roof after rain.
meanings.sent5: The shingled pathway led us through the forest, guiding our way.

meanings.sent1: He shingled the entire roof of the shed in just one day.
meanings.sent2: The roofers will shingle our house next week.
meanings.sent3: She decided to shingle her birdhouse with colorful tiles.
meanings.sent4: The artist shingled the mosaic with precision and care.
meanings.sent5: We need to shingle the gazebo before the rainy season starts.

meanings.definition: A small piece of wood that is used to cover a roof or wall.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter grabbed a shingled to repair the fence.
meanings.sent2: The roofers carried bundles of shingled up the ladder.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used a shingled to build its nest in the tree.
meanings.sent4: She found a perfect shingled to patch up the old barn.
meanings.sent5: The wind blew a shingled off the roof during the storm.
